title: Bypass Password Authentication to Update the Password

profile.name: X (Formerly Twitter)
profile.about: X helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**  This additional security measure from twitter provides protection to the victim's account, considering that a victim's session may have been hijacked by a hacker, however, due to this additional layer of security Implemented by twitter the hacker would not be able to change the victim's Password, as they will be prompted to enter the victim's account password In order to make these changes, which will not be known to a hacker (In case of a session hijack)

This report is to bring to your attention a security vulnerability that will allow hackers that have hijacked a user's session to bypass the password screen (Without knowing the user's password)

**Description:**  For users that have had their twitter flightschool session hijacked, this security vulnerability would enable a hacker to completely take over a victim's account as they will be able to change the victim's password by bypassing the old password by the unrestricted rate limit or brute forcing in the password
the victim account could be hijacked by session hijacking or XSS cookies grabbing 

## Steps To Reproduce:

With the assumption that the victim's twitter session is 'hijacked' and in a 'logged in' state for the hacker. The below steps must be followed In order to reproduce the security vulnerability.

Security Vulnerability #1 - Update Victim's Password - Bypass old password by unrestricted rate limiting

1.Go to My Profile
2.Click on Edit Profile-> Change Password
3.Enter any random password and Click on 'Next' F988224
4.Intercept the request the above request and send it to intruder F988225 
5.Then select the position old password F988226
6.Then go in payload add password list F988227
7.Then start the attack bcoz of no rate limit the password bruteforcing is continue and find the correct password and update the old one
F988228  , F988229



##Resolution: Apply the Rate Limitation

## Impact

This a serious security vulnerability, as It could lead to a hacker completely taking over the user's account by overriding twitter's security protocol as they could use this technique to bypass the password and it use to fully takeover the victim password

activities.message:
Thank you for your report @a13h1

When reporting rate limiting issues we generally need the following information about the tests that you performed:

1.       How many requests were you ultimately able to send? (e.g. 1000 requests successfully sent). Keep in mind that some rate limits may be set relatively high, so you may need to send a significant number (~ 1000) to test if rate limiting exists here.
3.       How fast were you able to send your requests? (e.g. 1000 requests were sent in 2 minutes)
4.       Some evidence that you were not silently prevented from completing your action (e.g. Did you actually receive login on your final request?)

Please provide us with this additional information about your tests so that we may more easily evaluate your report.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security

Hey @bugtriage-sophia  
I continue working on the issue and i found something more interesting as i explain how could the hacker take over the account by XSS

So here is the XSS in the Hidden input field To reproduce the Full issue of Account takeover by XSS 

##Steps To Reproduce:

##Security Vulnerability #1 - Xss in hidden input field 
1. Use this URL:- https://www.twitterflightschool.com/student/catalog/list?duration=&difficulty=&filter=jbkrf%20accesskey%3dx%20onclick%3dalert(document.cookie)%2f%2fhai3z&featured=&search=555-555-0199@example.com&course_type=all&inline_search=true&category_ids=&sort=most_recent
F990969, F990970

2. If you didn't get Automatic alert so use ALT+SHIFT+X bcoz sometimes in my browser its get auto alert or sometime i need to press keys (ALT+SHIFT+X) it is only working in Firefox

##RelatedMaterial:- 
https://portswigger.net/research/xss-in-hidden-input-fields
https://hackerone.com/reports/504984


So this is how the attacker grab the victim cookie with the help of cookie attacker access the account without even password 
To change the password the user use the below steps: 

##Security Vulnerability #2 - Update Victim's Password - Bypass old password by unrestricted rate limiting

1.Go to My Profile
2.Click on Edit Profile-> Change Password
3.Enter any random password and Click on 'Next' flightschool11.PNG (F988224)
4.Intercept the request the above request and send it to intruder flighschool12.PNG (F988225)
5.Then select the position old password flightschool13.PNG (F988226)
6.Then go in payload add password list flightschool14.PNG (F988227)
7.Then start the attack bcoz of no rate limit the password bruteforcing is continue and find the correct password and update the old one
flightschool1.PNG (F988228) , flightschool2.PNG (F988229)

So that's how the full method is working in real life And taking over the victim account without the password with the help of XSS and lack of rate limit

So if you satisfy with this could you update the Report tittle to Account Takeover By XSS & Lack Of Rate limit
Bcoz Account takeover is an Critical severity issue

Waiting for update

Thanks 
Best Regards

Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

Hey well XSS is patched but the Rate Limiting issue is still exist any update by you for this report...?
Is this report is eligible for bounty .,....?

Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. Unfortunately, this report does not fall in scope for a monetary reward at this time.  As a reminder, please remember to keep the details of this report private until we have fully investigated and addressed the issue.

@a13h1, it sounds like the XSS issue was resolved before we had a chance to investigate it, but in the future, please open a separate H1 report for issues like that if they are discovered after the initial report is filed.

In any case twitterflightschool.com is not in scope for monetary rewards. We're taking a look at the rate limiting issue, but there will be no payout for this report. Thank you for helping to keep Twitter secure!
